tei:p.tei:hi: Typed postcard from Hertzka (UE) to Schenker, dated November 23, 1908

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} Bücherzettel. An [typed:] Wohlgeboren [/] Herrn Prof. Dr. Heinrich Schenker, in [typed:] Wien III. Reisnerstr. 38

Vielleicht ist es Ihnen doch möglich, uns an einem der nächsten Tage das Vergnügen <sup><!--add-->Ihres Besuches</sup> zu machen, nachdem Ihre Instrumentaltabelle, Niloff: Instrumentations-Tabelle. welche zunächst in einer kleinen Auflage erschien, nunmehr in einer grossen Auflage An edition of 2,000 copies was received from the printers on February 9, 1909, and was classified as the official 1st edn. In a letter to J.G. Cotta of May 26, 1909 (CA 96–98), S gives us further information: “Thus it came about that a pseudonymous work of mine published by UE last Fall had such success that it sold 300 copies within the space of three weeks in Vienna alone, and after only two months a second edition had to be produced.” herauskommen soll und wir diesbezüglich einiges mit Ihnen zu besprechen hätten.
[printed:] [right side:] Hochachtungsvoll "Universal-Edition" A-G. (Jos. Aibl Verlag, G.m.b.H.) [signed:] Hertzka
[left side:] Wien, am [typed:] 23. 11. 1908 <strike>I. Maximilianstraße 11</strike> I. Wipplingerstrasse 32 (Telefon 4921, lokal u. interurban)

tei:p.tei:hi: Typed postcard from Hertzka (UE) to Schenker, dated November 23, 1908

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} Book Order Form To: [typed:] Prof. Heinrich Schenker, Esq., Vienna III, Reisnerstraße 38

Might it be possible for you to do us the pleasure <sup><!--add-->of paying us a visit</sup> in the next day or so, since your Instrumentations-Tabelle, which first appeared in a small edition, is now due to be released in a large edition and we have one or two things to speak to you about in this connection?
[printed:] [right side:] With kind regards, Universal Edition & Co. (Jos. Aibl Verlag & Co.) [signed:] Hertzka
[left side:] Vienna, [typed:] November 23, 1908 <strike>I. Maximilianstraße 11</strike> I. Wipplingerstraße 32 (Telephone 4921, local and suburban)
